intro: Alibertia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered alibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its showy, clustered inflorescences produce small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Alibertia longiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
